p: The consumer panel scores for milk showed than following oil supplementation in the cowsâ€™ diet, the perception of color changed ( p = 0.012), and there was a tendency for the mouthfeel to change ( p = 0.100, Table 4). The addition of antioxidants in the diets of cows tended to alter the perception of odor in the milk ( p = 0.086), and there was a significant interaction between oil and antioxidant supplementation for the perception of milk color (6.56, 5.73, 6.51 and 7.03, SEM = 0.25, for the C, A, O and OA treatments, respectively, p = 0.006).
